byline.original: By SUZANNE DALEY and ANEMONA HARTOCOLLIS

abstract: Analysts and experts contend Greeks' bold rejection of European loan bailout deal in public referendum is rooted in deep cultural and historical vein of defiance under seemingly hopeless circumstances; focus of glorious resistance in Greek psyche is seen by many as attribute honed over centuries under oppressive Ottoman rule and encouraged by telling of heroic tales for many generations.
lead_paragraph: Experts and analysts say the vote sprang from a deep cultural and historical strain of defiance in apparently hopeless situations, honed over centuries.

headline.main: Greek ‘No’ May Have Its Roots in Heroic Myths and Real Resistance
headline.print_headline: Greek ‘No’ May Have Its Roots in Heroic Myths and Real Resistance

snippet: Experts and analysts say the vote sprang from a deep cultural and historical strain of defiance in apparently hopeless situations, honed over centuries.
